global.isStructuredOutput();\n    if (!try ctx.store.exists(add_args.child)) {\n        try common.outputNotFoundError(DepResult, &ctx.output, structured_output, add_args.child, allocator);\n        return DepError.IssueNotFound;\n    }\n\n    if (!try ctx.store.exists(add_args.parent)) {\n        try common.outputNotFoundError(DepResult, &ctx.output, structured_output, add_args.parent, allocator);\n        return DepError.IssueNotFound;\n    }\n\n    const now = std.time.timestamp();\n    const dep = Dependency{\n        .issue_id = add_args.child,\n        .depends_on_id = add_args.parent,\n        .dep_type = DependencyType.fromString(add_args.dep_type),\n        .created_at = now,\n        .created_by = global.actor,\n        .metadata = null,\n        .thread_id = null,\n    };\n\n    graph.addDependency(dep) catch |err| {\n        const msg = switch (err) {\n            DependencyGraphError.SelfDependency => \"cannot depend on self\",\n dependency\",\n        };\n        try outputError(&ctx.output, structured_output, msg);\n\n        return switch (err) {\n            DependencyGraphError.SelfDependency => DepError.SelfDependency,\n };\n    };\n\n    try ctx.saveIfAutoFlush();\n\n    if (structured_output) {\n        try ctx.output.printJson(DepResult{\n            .success = true,\n            .action = \"added\",\n            .child = add_args.child,\n            .parent = add_args.parent,\n        });\n    } else if (!global.quiet) {\n        try ctx.output.success(\"Added dependency: {s} depends on {s}\", .{ add_args.child, add_args.parent });\n    }\n}\n\nfn runRemove(\n    graph: *DependencyGraph,\n    ctx: *CommandContext,\n    remove_args: anytype,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n) !void {\n    const structured_output = global.isStructuredOutput();\n    graph.removeDependency(remove_args.child, remove_args.parent) catch |err| {\n        const msg = if (err ==   return if (err == DependencyGraphError.IssueNotFound)\n            DepError.IssueNotFound\n        else\n            DepError.StorageError;\n    };\n\n    try ctx.saveIfAutoFlush();\n\n    if (structured_output) {\n        try ctx.output.printJson(DepResult{\n            .success = true,\n            .action = \"removed\",\n            .child = remove_args.child,\n            .parent = remove_args.parent,\n        });\n    } else if (!global.quiet) {\n        try ctx.output.success(\"Removed dependency: {s} no longer depends on {s}\", .{ remove_args.child, remove_args.parent });\n    }\n}\n\nfn runList(\n    graph: *DependencyGraph,\n    output: *common.Output,\n    list_args: anytype,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    const deps allocator.alloc([]const u8, deps.len);\n            for (deps, 0..) |dep, i| {\n                depends_on_ids.?[i] = dep.depends_on_id;\n            }\n        }\n\n        if (dependents.len > 0) {\n            blocks_ids = try allocator.alloc([]const u8, dependents.len);\n            for (dependents, 0..) |dep, i| {\n                blocks_ids.?[i] = dep.issue_id;\n            }\n        }\n\n        defer {\n            if (depends_on_ids) |ids| allocator.free(ids);\n            if (blocks_ids) |ids| allocator.free(ids);\n        }\n\n        try output.printJson(DepResult{\n try output.print(\"  - {s}\\n\", .{dep.issue_id});\n            }\n        } else {\n            try output.println(\"Blocks: (none)\", .{});\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nfn runTree(\n    output: Dependency graph operations for beads_zig.\n//!\n//! Provides dependency management including:\n//! - Add/remove dependencies\n//! - Cycle detection (DFS algorithm)\n//! - Query dependencies and dependents\n//! - Ready/blocked issue queries\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst store_mod = @import(\"store.zig\");\nconst IssueStore = store_mod.IssueStore;\nconst Issue = @import(\"../models/issue.zig\").Issue;\nconst Dependency = @import(\"../models/dependency.zig\").Dependency;\nconst DependencyType = @import(\"../models/dependency.zig\").DependencyType;\nconst Status = @import(\"../models/status.zig\").Status;\n\npub const DependencyGraphError = error{\n    SelfDependency,\n    CycleDetected,\n    DependencyNotFound,\n    IssueNotFound,\n};\n\npub const DependencyGraph = struct {\n    store: *IssueStore,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n\n    const Self = @This();\n\n    pub fn init(store: *IssueStore, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) Self {\n        return .{\n            .store = store,\n            .allocator = allocator,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Add a dependency (issue_id depends on depends_on_id).\n    /// Returns error.SelfDependency if trying to depend on self.\n    /// Returns error.CycleDetected if adding would create a cycle.\n    pub fn addDependency(self: *Self, dep: Dependency) !void {\n        // Check for self-dependency\n        if (std.mem.eql(u8, dep.issue_id, dep.depends_on_id)) {\n            return DependencyGraphError.SelfDependency;\n        }\n\n        // Check if issue exists\n        const issue = self.store.getRef(dep.issue_id) orelse\n            return DependencyGraphError.IssueNotFound;\n\n        // Check for cycles before inserting\n        if (try self.wouldCreateCycle(dep.issue_id, dep.depends_on_id)) {\n            return DependencyGraphError.CycleDetected;\n        }\n\n        // Check if dependency already exists\n        for (issue.dependencies) |existing| {\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, existing.depends_on_id, dep.depends_on_id)) {\n                return; // Already exists, no-op\n            }\n        }\n\n        // Clone and add the dependency\n        const cloned = try cloneDependency(dep, self.allocator);\n        errdefer freeDependency(@constCast(&cloned), self.allocator);\n\n        const new_deps = try self.allocator.alloc(Dependency, issue.dependencies.len + 1);\n        @memcpy(new_deps[0..issue.dependencies.len], issue.dependencies);\n        new_deps[issue.dependencies.len] = cloned;\n\n        // Only free the old array, not the dependency contents (they're now in new_deps)\n        if (issue.dependencies.len > 0) {\n            self.allocator.free(issue.dependencies);\n        }\n        issue.dependencies = new_deps;\n\n        try self.store.markDirty(dep.issue_id);\n    }\n\n    /// Remove a dependency.\n    pub fn removeDependency(self: *Self, issue_id: []const u8, depends_on_id: []const u8) !void {\n        const issue = self.store.getRef(issue_id) orelse\n            return DependencyGraphError.IssueNotFound;\n\n        var found_idx: ?usize = null;\n        for (issue.dependencies, 0..) |dep, i| {\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, dep.depends_on_id, depends_on_id)) {\n                found_idx = i;\n                break;\n            }\n        }\n\n        if (found_idx) |fi| {\n            freeDependency(@constCast(&issue.dependencies[fi]), self.allocator);\n\n            if (issue.dependencies.len == 1) {\n                self.allocator.free(issue.dependencies);\n                issue.dependencies = &[_]Dependency{};\n            } else {\n                const new_deps = try self.allocator.alloc(Dependency, issue.dependencies.len - 1);\n                var j: usize = 0;\n                for (issue.dependencies, 0..) |dep, i| {\n                    if (i != fi) {\n                        new_deps[j] = dep;\n                        j += 1;\n                    }\n                }\n                self.allocator.free(issue.dependencies);\n                issue.dependencies = new_deps;\n            }\n\n            try self.store.markDirty(issue_id);\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Get dependencies for an issue (what it depends on).\n    pub fn getDependencies(self: *Self, issue_id: []const u8) ![]Dependency {\n        const issue = self.store.getRef(issue_id) orelse return &[_]Dependency{};\n\n        if (issue.dependencies.len == 0) return &[_]Dependency{};\n\n        const deps = try self.allocator.alloc(Dependency, issue.dependencies.len);\n        errdefer self.allocator.free(deps);\n\n        for (issue.dependencies, 0..) |dep, i| {\n            deps[i] = try cloneDependency(dep, self.allocator);\n        }\n\n        return deps;\n    }\n\n    /// Get dependents of an issue (what depends on it).\n    pub fn getDependents(self: *Self, issue_id: []const u8) ![]Dependency {\n        var deps: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(Dependency) = .{};\n        errdefer {\n            for (deps.items) |*dep| {\n                freeDependency(dep, self.allocator);\n            }\n            deps.deinit(self.allocator);\n        }\n\n        for (self.store.getAllRef()) |issue| {\n            for (issue.dependencies) |dep| {\n                if (std.mem.eql(u8, dep.depends_on_id, issue_id)) {\n                    const cloned = try cloneDependency(dep, self.allocator);\n                    try deps.append(self.allocator, cloned);\n                }\n            }\n        }\n\n        return deps.toOwnedSlice(self.allocator);\n    }\n\n    /// Check if adding a dependency would create a cycle.\n    /// Uses DFS from depends_on_id to see if it can reach issue_id.\n    pub fn wouldCreateCycle(self: *Self, issue_id: []const u8, depends_on_id: []const u8) !bool {\n        var visited: std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(void) = .{};\n        defer {\n            var key_it = visited.keyIterator();\n            while (key_it.next()) |key| {\n                self.allocator.free(key.*);\n            }\n            visited.deinit(self.allocator);\n        }\n\n        return try self.dfsReachable(depends_on_id, issue_id, &visited);\n    }\n\n    fn dfsReachable(self: *Self, from: []const u8, target: []const u8, visited: *std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(void)) !bool {\n        if (std.mem.eql(u8, from, target)) return true;\n        if (visited.contains(from)) return false;\n\n        const from_copy = try self.allocator.dupe(u8, from);\n        errdefer self.allocator.free(from_copy);\n        try visited.put(self.allocator, from_copy, {});\n\n        const issue = self.store.getRef(from) orelse return false;\n\n        for (issue.dependencies) |dep| {\n            if (try self.dfsReachable(dep.depends_on_id, target, visited)) {\n                return true;\n            }\n        }\n        return false;\n    }\n\n    /// Detect all cycles in the dependency graph.\n    /// Returns array of cycle paths, or null if no cycles.\n    pub fn detectCycles(self: *Self) !?[][]const u8 {\n        var all_issues: std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(void) = .{};\n        defer {\n            var it = all_issues.keyIterator();\n            while (it.next()) |key| {\n                self.allocator.free(key.*);\n            }\n            all_issues.deinit(self.allocator);\n        }\n\n        // Collect all issue IDs involved in dependencies\n        for (self.store.getAllRef()) |issue| {\n            if (issue.dependencies.len > 0) {\n                if (!all_issues.contains(issue.id)) {\n                    const id_copy = try self.allocator.dupe(u8, issue.id);\n                    try all_issues.put(self.allocator, id_copy, {});\n                }\n                for (issue.dependencies) |dep| {\n                    if (!all_issues.contains(dep.depends_on_id)) {\n                        const id_copy = try self.allocator.dupe(u8, dep.depends_on_id);\n                        try all_issues.put(self.allocator, id_copy, {});\n                    }\n                }\n            }\n        }\n\n        var cycles: std.ArrayListUnmanaged([]const u8) = .{};\n        errdefer {\n            for (cycles.items) |c| {\n                self.allocator.free(c);\n            }\n            cycles.deinit(self.allocator);\n        }\n\n        var visited: std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(void) = .{};\n        defer visited.deinit(self.allocator);\n\n        var rec_stack: std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(void) = .{};\n        defer rec_stack.deinit(self.allocator);\n\n        var it = all_issues.keyIterator();\n        while (it.next()) |key| {\n            if (!visited.contains(key.*)) {\n                var path: std.ArrayListUnmanaged([]const u8) = .{};\n                defer path.deinit(self.allocator);\n\n                if (try self.detectCycleDfs(key.*, &visited, &rec_stack, &path)) {\n                    const cycle_str = try std.mem.join(self.allocator, \" -> \", path.items);\n                    try cycles.append(self.allocator, cycle_str);\n                }\n            }\n        }\n\n        if (cycles.items.len == 0) {\n            return null;\n        }\n\n        return try cycles.toOwnedSlice(self.allocator);\n    }\n\n    fn detectCycleDfs(\n        self: *Self,\n        node: []const u8,\n        visited: *std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(void),\n        rec_stack: *std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(void),\n        path: *std.ArrayListUnmanaged([]const u8),\n    ) !bool {\n        try visited.put(self.allocator, node, {});\n        try rec_stack.put(self.allocator, node, {});\n        try path.append(self.allocator, node);\n\n        const issue = self.store.getRef(node) orelse {\n            _ = path.pop();\n            _ = rec_stack.remove(node);\n            return false;\n        };\n\n        for (issue.dependencies) |dep| {\n            if (!visited.contains(dep.depends_on_id)) {\n                if (try self.detectCycleDfs(dep.depends_on_id, visited, rec_stack, path)) {\n                    return true;\n                }\n            } else if (rec_stack.contains(dep.depends_on_id)) {\n                try path.append(self.allocator, dep.depends_on_id);\n                return true;\n            }\n        }\n\n        _ = rec_stack.remove(node);\n        _ = path.pop();\n        return false;\n    }\n\n    /// Get all issues that are ready (open, not blocked by open issues, not deferred).\n    pub fn getReadyIssues(self: *Self) ![]Issue {\n        const now = std.time.timestamp();\n\n        var results: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(Issue) = .{};\n        errdefer {\n            for (results.items) |*issue| {\n                issue.deinit(self.allocator);\n            }\n            results.deinit(self.allocator);\n        }\n\n        for (self.store.getAllRef()) |issue| {\n            // Must be open\n            if (!statusEql(issue.status, .open)) continue;\n\n            // Must not be deferred to future\n            if (issue.defer_until.value) |defer_time| {\n                if (defer_time > now) continue;\n            }\n\n            // Must not have any open blockers\n            var has_open_blocker = false;\n            for (issue.dependencies) |dep| {\n                if (self.store.getRef(dep.depends_on_id)) |blocker| {\n                    if (!statusEql(blocker.status, .closed) and\n                        !statusEql(blocker.status, .tombstone))\n                    {\n                        has_open_blocker = true;\n                        break;\n                    }\n                }\n            }\n            if (has_open_blocker) continue;\n\n            try results.append(self.allocator, try issue.clone(self.allocator));\n        }\n\n        // Sort by priority then created_at\n        std.mem.sortUnstable(Issue, results.items, {}, struct {\n            fn lessThan(_: void, a: Issue, b: Issue) bool {\n                if (a.priority.value != b.priority.value) {\n                    return a.priority.value < b.priority.value;\n                }\n                return a.created_at.value < b.created_at.value;\n            }\n        }.lessThan);\n\n        return results.toOwnedSlice(self.allocator);\n    }\n\n    /// Get all blocked issues (open issues with unresolved dependencies).\n    pub fn getBlockedIssues(self: *Self) ![]Issue {\n        var results: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(Issue) = .{};\n        errdefer {\n            for (results.items) |*issue| {\n                issue.deinit(self.allocator);\n            }\n            results.deinit(self.allocator);\n        }\n\n        for (self.store.getAllRef()) |issue| {\n            // Must be open\n            if (!statusEql(issue.status, .open)) continue;\n\n            // Must have at least one open blocker\n            var has_open_blocker = false;\n            for (issue.dependencies) |dep| {\n                if (self.store.getRef(dep.depends_on_id)) |blocker| {\n                    if (!statusEql(blocker.status, .closed) and\n                        !statusEql(blocker.status, .tombstone))\n                    {\n                        has_open_blocker = true;\n                        break;\n                    }\n                }\n            }\n            if (!has_open_blocker) continue;\n\n            try results.append(self.allocator, try issue.clone(self.allocator));\n        }\n\n        // Sort by priority then created_at\n        std.mem.sortUnstable(Issue, results.items, {}, struct {\n            fn lessThan(_: void, a: Issue, b: Issue) bool {\n                if (a.priority.value != b.priority.value) {\n                    return a.priority.value < b.priority.value;\n                }\n                return a.created_at.value < b.created_at.value;\n            }\n        }.lessThan);\n\n        return results.toOwnedSlice(self.allocator);\n    }\n\n    /// Get blockers for an issue (open issues that this issue depends on).\n    pub fn getBlockers(self: *Self, issue_id: []const u8) ![]Issue {\n        var results: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(Issue) = .{};\n        errdefer {\n            for (results.items) |*issue| {\n                issue.deinit(self.allocator);\n            }\n            results.deinit(self.allocator);\n        }\n\n        const issue = self.store.getRef(issue_id) orelse return results.toOwnedSlice(self.allocator);\n\n        for (issue.dependencies) |dep| {\n            if (self.store.getRef(dep.depends_on_id)) |blocker| {\n                if (!statusEql(blocker.status, .closed) and\n                    !statusEql(blocker.status, .tombstone))\n                {\n                    try results.append(self.allocator, try blocker.clone(self.allocator));\n                }\n            }\n        }\n\n        return results.toOwnedSlice(self.allocator);\n    }\n\n    /// Free an array of dependencies.\n    pub fn freeDependencies(self: *Self, deps: []Dependency) void {\n        for (deps) |*dep| {\n            freeDependency(dep, self.allocator);\n        }\n        self.allocator.free(deps);\n    }\n\n    /// Free an array of issues.\n    pub fn freeIssues(self: *Self, issues: []Issue) void {\n        for (issues) |*issue| {\n            issue.deinit(self.allocator);\n        }\n        self.allocator.free(issues);\n    }\n\n    /// Free an array of cycle strings.\n    pub fn freeCycles(self: *Self, cycles: [][]const u8) void {\n        for (cycles) |c| {\n            self.allocator.free(c);\n        }\n        self.allocator.free(cycles);\n    }\n};\n\n// Helper functions\nfn statusEql(a: Status, b: Status) bool {\n    const Tag = std.meta.Tag(Status);\n    const tag_a: Tag = a;\n    const tag_b: Tag = b;\n    if (tag_a != tag_b) return false;\n    return if (tag_a == .custom) std.mem.eql(u8, a.custom, b.custom) else true;\n}\n\nfn cloneDependency(dep: Dependency, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) !Dependency {\n    var result: Dependency = undefined;\n\n    result.issue_id = try allocator.dupe(u8, dep.issue_id);\n    errdefer allocator.free(result.issue_id);\n\n    result.depends_on_id = try allocator.dupe(u8, dep.depends_on_id);\n    errdefer allocator.free(result.depends_on_id);\n\n    result.dep_type = switch (dep.dep_type) {\n        .custom => |s| .{ .custom = try allocator.dupe(u8, s) },\n        else => dep.dep_type,\n    };\n\n    result.created_at = dep.created_at;\n    result.created_by = if (dep.created_by) |c| try allocator.dupe(u8, c) else null;\n    result.metadata = if (dep.metadata) |m| try allocator.dupe(u8, m) else null;\n    result.thread_id = if (dep.thread_id) |t| try allocator.dupe(u8, t) else null;\n\n    return result;\n}\n\nfn freeDependency(dep: *Dependency, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) void {\n    allocator.free(dep.issue_id);\n    allocator.free(dep.depends_on_id);\n    switch (dep.dep_type) {\n        .custom => |s| allocator.free(s),\n        else => {},\n    }\n    if (dep.created_by) |c| allocator.free(c);\n    if (dep.metadata) |m| allocator.free(m);\n    if (dep.thread_id) |t| allocator.free(t);\n}\n\n// --- Tests ---\n\ntest \"DependencyGraph rejects self-dependency\" {\n    const allocator = = DependencyGraph.init(&store, allocator);\n\n    const dep = Dependency{\n        .issue_id = \"bd-self\",\n        .depends_on_id = \"bd-self\",\n        .dep_type = .blocks,\n        .created_at = Provides workspace loading, error handling, and shared result types\n//! to reduce duplication across command implementations.\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst storage = @import(\"../storage/mod.zig\");\nconst output_mod = @import(\"../output/mod.zig\");\nconst args = @import(\"args.zig\");\n\npub const Output = output_mod.Output;\npub const OutputOptions = output_mod.OutputOptions;\npub const IssueStore = storage.IssueStore;\npub const DependencyGraph = storage.DependencyGraph;\n\n/// Common errors shared across CLI commands.\npub const CommandError = error{\n    WorkspaceNotInitialized,\n    StorageError,\n    OutOfMemory,\n};\n\n/// Context for executing a CLI command with an initialized workspace.\npub const CommandContext = struct {\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n    output: Output,\n    store: IssueStore,\n    issues_path: []const u8,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n\n    /// Initialize a command context by loading the workspace.\n    /// Returns null and outputs an error if workspace is not initialized.\n    pub fn init(\n        allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n        global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    ) CommandError!?CommandContext {\n        var output = Output.init(allocator, .{\n            .json = global.json,\n            .toon = global.toon,\n            .quiet = global.quiet,\n            .silent = global.silent,\n            .no_color = global.no_color,\n        });\n\n        const beads_dir = global.data_path orelse \".beads\";\n        const issues_path = std.fs.path.join(allocator, &.{ beads_dir, \"issues.jsonl\" }) catch {\n            return CommandError.OutOfMemory;\n        };\n\n        std.fs.cwd().access(issues_path, .{}) catch |err| {\n            if (err == error.FileNotFound) {\n                outputErrorGeneric(&output, global.isStructuredOutput(), \"workspace not initialized. Run 'bz init' first.\") catch {};\n                allocator.free(issues_path);\n                return null;\n            }\n            outputErrorGeneric(&output, global.isStructuredOutput(), \"cannot access workspace\") catch {};\n            allocator.free(issues_path);\n            return CommandError.StorageError;\n        };\n\n        var store = IssueStore.init(allocator, issues_path);\n\n        store.loadFromFile() catch |err| {\n            if (err != error.FileNotFound) {\n                outputErrorGeneric(&output, global.isStructuredOutput(), \"failed to load issues\") catch {};\n                store.deinit();\n                allocator.free(issues_path);\n                return CommandError.StorageError;\n            }\n        };\n\n        return CommandContext{\n            .allocator = allocator,\n            .output = output,\n            .store = store,\n            .issues_path = issues_path,\n            .global = global,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Clean up resources.\n    pub fn deinit(self: *CommandContext) void {\n        self.store.deinit();\n        self.allocator.free(self.issues_path);\n    }\n\n    /// Save the store to file if auto-flush is enabled.\n    pub fn saveIfAutoFlush(self: *CommandContext) CommandError!void {\n        if (!self.global.no_auto_flush) {\n            self.store.saveToFile() catch {\n                outputErrorGeneric(&self.output, self.global.isStructuredOutput(), \"failed to save issues\") catch {};\n                return CommandError.StorageError;\n            };\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Create a dependency graph from the store.\n    pub fn createGraph(self: *CommandContext) DependencyGraph {\n        return DependencyGraph.init(&self.store, self.allocator);\n    }\n};\n\n/// Output a generic error message in the appropriate format.\npub fn outputErrorGeneric(output: *Output, json_mode: bool, message: []const u8) !void {\n    if (json_mode) {\n        try output.printJson(.{\n            .success = false,\n            .message = message,\n        });\n    } else {\n        try output.err(\"{s}\", .{message});\n    }\n}\n\n/// Output an error with a specific result type for JSON mode.\npub fn outputErrorTyped(\n    comptime T: type,\n    output: *Output,\n    json_mode: bool,\n    message: []const u8,\n) !void {\n    if (json_mode) {\n        const result = T{ .success = false, .message = message };\n        try output.printJson(result);\n    } else {\n        try output.err(\"{s}\", .{message});\n    }\n}\n\n/// Output a \"not found\" error for an issue.\npub fn outputNotFoundError(\n    comptime T: type,\n    output: *Output,\n    json_mode: bool,\n    id: []const u8,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(allocator, \"issue not found: {s}\", .{id});\n    defer allocator.free(msg);\n    try outputErrorTyped(T, output, json_mode, msg);\n}\n\n/// Initialize just the output without loading workspace.\n/// Useful for commands that do their own workspace handling.\npub fn initOutput(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, global: args.GlobalOptions) Output {\n    return Output.init(allocator, .{\n        .json = global.json,\n        .toon = global.toon,\n        .quiet = global.quiet,\n        .silent = global.silent,\n        .no_color = global.no_color,\n    });\n}\n\n// --- Tests ---\n\ntest \"CommandContext returns null for uninitialized workspace\" {\n    const allocator = std.testing.allocator;\n    const global = args.GlobalOptions{ .silent = true, .data_path = \"/nonexistent/path\" };\n\n    const ctx = try CommandContext.init(allocator, global);\n    try std.testing.expect(ctx == null);\n}\n","numLines":164,"startLine":1,"totalLines":164}}}

{"type":"assistant","message":{"model":"claude-opus-4-5-20251101","id":"msg_01DxjAV47FD2MMbEZQewNDDC","type":"message","role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"tool_use","id":"toolu_01HXoQxJamdvBfKYkzVeSYJq","name":"Write","input":{"file_path":"/home/hotschmoe/beads_zig/src/cli/graph.zig","content":"//! Dependency graph visualization commands for beads_zig.\n//!\n//! `bz graph` - Show dependency graph for all issues\n//! `bz graph <id>` - Show dependency graph for a specific issue\n//! `bz graph --format dot` - Export in DOT format for Graphviz\n//!\n//! Provides ASCII tree visualization and DOT format export for dependency graphs.\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst models = @import(\"../models/mod.zig\");\nconst storage = @import(\"../storage/mod.zig\");\nconst common = @import(\"common.zig\");\nconst args = @import(\"args.zig\");\n\nconst Issue = models.Issue;\nconst Status = models.Status;\nconst CommandContext = common.CommandContext;\nconst DependencyGraph = common.DependencyGraph;\nconst Output = common.Output;\n\npub const GraphError = error{\n    WorkspaceNotInitialized,\n    IssueNotFound,\n    StorageError,\n    OutOfMemory,\n};\n\npub const GraphNode = struct {\n    id: []const u8,\n    title: []const u8,\n    status: []const u8,\n};\n\npub const GraphEdge = struct {\n    from: []const u8,\n    to: []const u8,\n    dep_type: []const u8,\n};\n\npub const GraphResult = struct {\n    success: bool,\n    format: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    node_count: ?usize = null,\n    edge_count: ?usize = null,\n    nodes: ?[]const GraphNode = null,\n    edges: ?[]const GraphEdge = null,\n    output: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    message: ?[]const u8 = null,\n};\n\npub fn run(\n    graph_args: args.GraphArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var ctx = (try CommandContext.init(allocator, global)) orelse {\n        return GraphError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n    };\n    defer ctx.deinit();\n\n    var dep_graph = ctx.createGraph();\n\n    if (graph_args.id) |id| {\n        if (!try ctx.store.exists(id)) {\n            try common.outputNotFoundError(GraphResult, &ctx.output, global.isStructuredOutput(), id, allocator);\n            return GraphError.IssueNotFound;\n        }\n        try renderIssueGraph(&dep_graph, &ctx.output, id, graph_args, global, allocator);\n    } else {\n        try renderFullGraph(&ctx.store, &ctx.output, graph_args, global, allocator);\n    }\n}\n\nfn renderIssueGraph(\n    graph: *DependencyGraph,\n    output: *Output,\n    issue_id: []const u8,\n    graph_args: args.GraphArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    switch (graph_args.format) {\n        .ascii => try renderAsciiTree(graph, output, issue_id, graph_args.depth, global, allocator),\n        .dot => try renderDotGraph(graph, output, issue_id, graph_args.depth, global, allocator),\n    }\n}\n\nfn renderFullGraph(\n    store: *storage.IssueStore,\n    output: *Output,\n    graph_args: args.GraphArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    switch (graph_args.format) {\n        .ascii => try renderAsciiFullGraph(store, output, global, allocator),\n        .dot => try renderDotFullGraph(store, output, global, allocator),\n    }\n}\n\nfn renderAsciiTree(\n    graph: *DependencyGraph,\n    output: *Output,\n    root_id: []const u8,\n    max_depth: ?u32,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var buf = std.ArrayList(u8).init(allocator);\n    defer buf.deinit();\n    const writer = buf.writer();\n\n    var visited: std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(void) = .{};\n    defer visited.deinit(allocator);\n\n    const issue = graph.store.getRef(root_id) orelse return;\n    try writer.print(\"{s} [{s}] - {s}\\n\", .{ issue.id, issue.status.toString(), truncateTitle(issue.title, 50) });\n\n    try renderAsciiSubtree(graph, writer, root_id, \"\", true, 1, max_depth orelse 10, &visited, allocator);\n\n    if (global.isStructuredOutput()) {\n        try output.printJson(GraphResult{\n            .success = true,\n            .format = \"ascii\",\n            .output = buf.items,\n        });\n    } else {\n        try output.raw(buf.items);\n    }\n}\n\nfn renderAsciiSubtree(\n    graph: *DependencyGraph,\n    writer: anytype,\n    issue_id: []const u8,\n    prefix: []const u8,\n    is_last: bool,\n    depth: u32,\n    max_depth: u32,\n    visited: *std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(void),\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    if (depth > max_depth) return;\n\n    const id_key = try allocator.dupe(u8, issue_id);\n    if (visited.contains(id_key)) {\n        allocator.free(id_key);\n        return;\n    }\n    try visited.put(allocator, id_key, {});\n\n    const deps = try graph.getDependencies(issue_id);\n    defer graph.freeDependencies(deps);\n\n    for (deps, 0..) |dep, i| {\n        const is_last_dep = (i == deps.len - 1);\n        const connector = if (is_last_dep) \"`-- \" else \"|-- \";\n        const new_prefix_ext = if (is_last_dep) \"    \" else \"|   \";\n\n        const new_prefix = try std.mem.concat(allocator, u8, &.{ prefix, new_prefix_ext });\n        defer allocator.free(new_prefix);\n\n        if (graph.store.getRef(dep.depends_on_id)) |blocker| {\n            const status_indicator = if (statusEql(blocker.status, .closed)) \"[x]\" else \"[ ]\";\n            try writer.print(\"{s}{s}{s} {s} - {s}\\n\", .{\n                prefix,\n                connector,\n                blocker.id,\n                status_indicator,\n                truncateTitle(blocker.title, 40),\n            });\n\n            try renderAsciiSubtree(graph, writer, dep.depends_on_id, new_prefix, is_last_dep, depth + 1, GraphError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n    };\n    defer ctx.deinit();\n\n    var dep_graph = ctx.createGraph();\n\n    if (graph_args.id) |id| {\n        if (!try ctx.store.exists(id)) {\n            try common.outputNotFoundError(GraphResult, &ctx.output, global.isStructuredOutput(), id, allocator);\n            return GraphError.IssueNotFound;\n        }\n        try renderIssueGraph(&dep_graph, &ctx.output, id, graph_args, global, allocator);\n    } else {\n        try renderFullGraph(&ctx.store, &ctx.output, graph_args, global, allocator);\n    }\n}\n\nfn renderIssueGraph(\n    graph: *DependencyGraph,\n    output: *Output,\n    issue_id: []const u8,\n    graph_args: args.GraphArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    switch (graph_args.format) {\n        .ascii => try renderAsciiTree(graph, output, issue_id, graph_args.depth, global, allocator),\n        .dot => try renderDotGraph(graph, output, issue_id, graph_args.depth, global, allocator),\n    }\n}\n\nfn renderFullGraph(\n    store: *storage.IssueStore,\n    output: *Output,\n    graph_args: args.GraphArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    switch (graph_args.format) {\n        .ascii => try renderAsciiFullGraph(store, output, global, allocator),\n        .dot => try renderDotFullGraph(store, output, global, allocator),\n    }\n}\n\nfn renderAsciiTree(\n    graph: *DependencyGraph,\n    output: *Output,\n    root_id: []const u8,\n    max_depth: ?u32,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var buf: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(u8) = .{};\n    defer buf.deinit(allocator);\n    const writer = buf.writer(allocator);\n\n    var visited: std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(void) = .{};\n    defer visited.deinit(allocator);\n\n    const issue = graph.store.getRef(root_id) orelse return;\n    try writer.print(\"{s} [{s}] - {s}\\n\", .{ issue.id, issue.status.toString(), truncateTitle(issue.title, 50) });\n\n    try renderAsciiSubtree(graph, writer, root_id, \"\", true, 1, max_depth orelse 10, &visited, allocator);\n\n    if (global.isStructuredOutput()) {\n        try output.printJson(GraphResult{\n            .success = true,\n            .format = \"ascii\",\n            .output = buf.items,\n        });\n    } else {\n        try output.raw(buf.items);\n    }\n}\n\nfn renderAsciiSubtree(\n    graph: *DependencyGraph,\n    writer: anytype,\n    issue_id: []const u8,\n    prefix: []const u8,\n    _: bool, // const connector = if (is_last_dep) \"`-- \" else \"|-- \";\n        const new_prefix_ext = if (is_last_dep) \"    \" else \"|   \";\n\n        const new_prefix = try std.mem.concat(allocator, u8, &.{ }\n}\n\nfn renderAsciiFullGraph(\n    store: *storage.IssueStore,\n    output: *Output,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var buf = {\n                    try writer.print(\"  {s}{s} [?] - (not found)\\n\", .{ connector, dep.depends_on_id });\n                }\n            }\n            try writer.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n        }\n CommandContext.init(allocator, global)) orelse {\n        return GraphError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n    };\n    defer ctx.deinit();\n\n    var dep_graph = ctx.createGraph();\n\n    if (graph_args.id) |id| {\n        if (!try ctx.store.exists(id)) {\n            try common.outputNotFoundError(GraphResult, &ctx.output, global.isStructuredOutput(), id, allocator);\n            return graph_args, global, allocator);\n    }\n}\n\nfn renderIssueGraph(\n    graph: *DependencyGraph,\n    output: *Output,\n    issue_id: []const u8,\n    graph_args: args.GraphArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    switch (graph_args.format) {\n        .ascii => try renderAsciiTree(graph, output, issue_id, graph_args.depth, global, root_id: []const u8,\n    max_depth: ?u32,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var buf: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(u8) = .{};\n    defer       if (graph.store.getRef(dep.depends_on_id)) |blocker| {\n            const status_indicator = if (statusEql(blocker.status, .closed)) \"[x]\" else \"[ ]\";\n            try try writer.print(\"  {s}{s} {s} - {s}\\n\", .{ connector, blocker.id, blocker_status, truncateTitle(blocker.title, 40) });\n                } else {\n                    try writer.print(\"  {s}{s} root_id: []const u8,\n    max_depth: ?u32,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var buf: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(u8) = .{};\n    defer const issues = store.getAllRef();\n\n    try writer.writeAll(\"digraph dependencies {\\n\");\n    try writer.writeAll(\"  rankdir=TB;\\n\");\n    try writer.writeAll(\"  node [shape=box, Provides ASCII tree visualization and DOT format export for dependency graphs.\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst models = @import(\"../models/mod.zig\");\nconst storage = @import(\"../storage/mod.zig\");\nconst common = @import(\"common.zig\");\nconst args = @import(\"args.zig\");\n\nconst Issue = models.Issue;\nconst Status = models.Status;\nconst CommandContext = u8,\n};\n\npub const GraphEdge = struct {\n    from: []const u8,\n    to: []const u8,\n    dep_type: []const u8,\n};\n\npub const GraphResult = struct {\n    success: bool,\n    format: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    node_count: ?usize = null,\n    edge_count: ?usize = null,\n    nodes: ?[]const GraphNode = null,\n    edges: ?[]const GraphEdge = null,\n    output: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    message: ?[]const u8 = null,\n};\n\npub fn run(\n    graph_args: args.GraphArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var ctx = (try CommandContext.init(allocator, global)) orelse {\n        return GraphError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n    };\n    defer ctx.deinit();\n\n    var dep_graph = ctx.createGraph();\n\n    if (graph_args.id) |id| {\n        if (!try ctx.store.exists(id)) {\n            try common.outputNotFoundError(GraphResult, &ctx.output, global.isStructuredOutput(), id, allocator);\n            return GraphError.IssueNotFound;\n        }\n        try renderIssueGraph(&dep_graph, &ctx.output, id, graph_args, global, allocator);\n    } else {\n        try renderFullGraph(&ctx.store, &ctx.output, graph_args, global, allocator);\n    }\n}\n\nfn renderIssueGraph(\n    graph: *DependencyGraph,\n    output: *Output,\n    issue_id: []const u8,\n    graph_args: args.GraphArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    switch (graph_args.format) {\n        .ascii => try renderAsciiTree(graph, output, issue_id, graph_args.depth, global, allocator),\n        .dot => try renderDotGraph(graph, output, issue_id, graph_args.depth, global, allocator),\n    }\n}\n\nfn renderFullGraph(\n    store: *storage.IssueStore,\n    output: *Output,\n    graph_args: args.GraphArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    switch (graph_args.format) {\n        .ascii => try renderAsciiFullGraph(store, output, global, allocator),\n        .dot => try renderDotFullGraph(store, output, global, allocator),\n    }\n}\n\nfn renderAsciiTree(\n    graph: *DependencyGraph,\n    output: *Output,\n    root_id: []const u8,\n    max_depth: ?u32,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var buf: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(u8) = .{};\n    defer buf.deinit(allocator);\n    const writer = buf.writer(allocator);\n\n    var visited: std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(void) = .{};\n    defer visited.deinit(allocator);\n\n    const issue = graph.store.getRef(root_id) orelse return;\n    try writer.print(\"{s} [{s}] - {s}\\n\", .{ issue.id, issue.status.toString(), truncateTitle(issue.title, 50) });\n\n    try renderAsciiSubtree(graph, writer, root_id, \"\", true, 1, max_depth orelse 10, &visited, allocator);\n\n    if (global.isStructuredOutput()) {\n        try output.printJson(GraphResult{\n            .success = true,\n tombstone, pinned |\n| priority | number | yes | 0 (critical) to 4 (backlog) |\n| issue_type | string | yes | task, bug, feature, epic, chore, docs, question |\n| assignee | string | no | Assigned user |\n| owner | string | no | Issue owner |\n| created_at | string | yes | RFC3339 timestamp |\n| created_by | string | no | Creator |\n| updated_at | string | yes | RFC3339 timestamp |\n| closed_at | string | no | RFC3339 timestamp when closed |\n| close_reason | string | no | Reason for closing |\n| due_at | string | no | RFC3339 due date |\n| defer_until | string | no | RFC3339 defer date |\n| estimated_minutes | number | no | Time estimate |\n| external_ref | string | no | External tracker link |\n| source_system | string | no | Import source |\n| pinned | boolean | yes | High-priority display flag |\n| is_template | boolean | yes | Template flag |\n| labels | array | yes | String array of labels |\n| dependencies | array | yes | Array of Dependency objects |\n| comments | array | yes | Array of Comment objects |\n\n## WAL Entry (beads.wal)\n\nWrite-ahead log for concurrent writes.\n\n### Fields\n\n| Field | Type | Description |\n|-------|------|-------------|\n| op | string | add, update, close, reopen, delete, set_blocked, unset_blocked |\n| ts | number | Unix timestamp for ordering |\n| id | string | Issue ID |\n| data | object | Full Issue object (for add/update) or null |\n\n## Dependency\n\nEmbedded in Issue.dependencies array.\n\n### Fields\n\n| Field | Type | Description |\n|-------|------|-------------|\n| issue_id | string | Dependent issue |\n| depends_on_id | string | Blocker issue |\n| dep_type | string | blocks, parent_child, waits_for, related, etc. |\n| created_at | string | RFC3339 timestamp |\n| created_by | string | Creator |\n| metadata | string | JSON blob for extra data |\n| thread_id | string | Optional thread reference |\n\n## Comment\n\nEmbedded in Issue.comments array.\n\n### Fields\n\n| Field | Type | Description |\n|-------|------|-------------|\n| id | number | Comment ID |\n| issue_id | string | Parent issue ID |\n| author | string | Comment author |\n| body | string | Comment text |\n| created_at | string | RFC3339 timestamp |\nOK\n236/523 cli.schema.test.run with json Dependency graph visualization commands for beads_zig.\n//!\n//! `bz graph` - Show dependency graph for all issues\n//! `bz graph <id>` - Show dependency graph for a specific issue\n//! `bz graph --format dot` - Export in DOT format for Graphviz\n//!\n//! Provides ASCII tree visualization and DOT format export for dependency graphs.\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst models = @import(\"../models/mod.zig\");\nconst storage = @import(\"../storage/mod.zig\");\nconst common = @import(\"common.zig\");\nconst args = @import(\"args.zig\");\n\nconst Issue = models.Issue;\nconst Status = models.Status;\nconst CommandContext = common.CommandContext;\nconst DependencyGraph = common.DependencyGraph;\nconst Output = common.Output;\n\nconst EdgeItem = struct { from: []const u8, to: []const u8 };\n\npub const GraphError = error{\n    WorkspaceNotInitialized,\n    IssueNotFound,\n    StorageError,\n    OutOfMemory,\n};\n\npub const GraphNode = struct {\n    id: []const u8,\n    title: []const u8,\n    status: []const u8,\n};\n\npub const GraphEdge = struct {\n    from: []const u8,\n    to: []const u8,\n    dep_type: []const u8,\n};\n\npub const GraphResult = struct {\n    success: bool,\n    format: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    node_count: ?usize = null,\n    edge_count: ?usize = null,\n    nodes: ?[]const GraphNode = null,\n    edges: ?[]const GraphEdge = null,\n    output: ?[]const u8 = null,\n    message: ?[]const u8 = null,\n};\n\npub fn run(\n    graph_args: args.GraphArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var ctx = (try CommandContext.init(allocator, global)) orelse {\n        return GraphError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n    };\n    defer ctx.deinit();\n\n    var dep_graph = ctx.createGraph();\n\n    if (graph_args.id) |id| {\n        if (!try ctx.store.exists(id)) {\n            try common.outputNotFoundError(GraphResult, &ctx.output, global.isStructuredOutput(), id, allocator);\n            return GraphError.IssueNotFound;\n        }\n        try renderIssueGraph(&dep_graph, &ctx.output, id, graph_args, global, allocator);\n    } else {\n        try renderFullGraph(&ctx.store, &ctx.output, graph_args, global, allocator);\n    }\n}\n\nfn renderIssueGraph(\n    graph: *DependencyGraph,\n    output: *Output,\n    issue_id: []const u8,\n    graph_args: args.GraphArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    switch (graph_args.format) {\n        .ascii => try renderAsciiTree(graph, output, issue_id, graph_args.depth, global, allocator),\n        .dot => try renderDotGraph(graph, output, issue_id, graph_args.depth, global, allocator),\n    }\n}\n\nfn renderFullGraph(\n    store: *storage.IssueStore,\n    output: *Output,\n    graph_args: args.GraphArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    switch (graph_args.format) {\n        .ascii => try renderAsciiFullGraph(store, output, global, allocator),\n        .dot => try renderDotFullGraph(store, output, global, allocator),\n    }\n}\n\nfn renderAsciiTree(\n    graph: *DependencyGraph,\n    output: *Output,\n    root_id: []const u8,\n    max_depth: ?u32,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var buf: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(u8) = .{};\n    defer buf.deinit(allocator);\n    const writer = buf.writer(allocator);\n\n    var visited: std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(void) = .{};\n    defer visited.deinit(allocator);\n\n    const issue = graph.store.getRef(root_id) orelse return;\n    try writer.print(\"{s} [{s}] - {s}\\n\", .{ issue.id, issue.status.toString(), truncateTitle(issue.title, 50) });\n\n    try renderAsciiSubtree(graph, writer, root_id, \"\", true, 1, max_depth orelse 10, &visited, allocator);\n\n    if (global.isStructuredOutput()) {\n        try output.printJson(GraphResult{\n            .success = true,\n            .format = \"ascii\",\n            .output = buf.items,\n        });\n    } else {\n        try output.raw(buf.items);\n    }\n}\n\nfn renderAsciiSubtree(\n    graph: *DependencyGraph,\n    writer: anytype,\n    issue_id: []const u8,\n    prefix: []const u8,\n    _: bool, // is_last - unused, kept for API symmetry\n    depth: u32,\n    max_depth: u32,\n    visited: *std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(void),\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    if (depth > max_depth) return;\n\n    const id_key = try allocator.dupe(u8, issue_id);\n    if (visited.contains(id_key)) {\n        allocator.free(id_key);\n        return;\n    }\n    try visited.put(allocator, id_key, {});\n\n    const deps = try graph.getDependencies(issue_id);\n    defer graph.freeDependencies(deps);\n\n    for (deps, 0..) |dep, i| {\n        const is_last_dep = (i == deps.len - 1);\n        const connector = if (is_last_dep) \"`-- \" else \"|-- \";\n        const new_prefix_ext = if (is_last_dep) \"    \" else \"|   \";\n\n        const new_prefix = try std.mem.concat(allocator, u8, &.{ prefix, new_prefix_ext });\n        defer allocator.free(new_prefix);\n\n        if (graph.store.getRef(dep.depends_on_id)) |blocker| {\n            const status_indicator = if (statusEql(blocker.status, .closed)) \"[x]\" else \"[ ]\";\n            try writer.print(\"{s}{s}{s} {s} - {s}\\n\", .{\n                prefix,\n                connector,\n                blocker.id,\n                status_indicator,\n                truncateTitle(blocker.title, 40),\n            });\n\n            try renderAsciiSubtree(graph, writer, dep.depends_on_id, new_prefix, is_last_dep, depth + 1, max_depth, visited, allocator);\n        } else {\n            try writer.print(\"{s}{s}{s} [?] - (not found)\\n\", .{ prefix, connector, dep.depends_on_id });\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nfn renderAsciiFullGraph(\n    store: *storage.IssueStore,\n    output: *Output,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var buf: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(u8) = .{};\n    defer buf.deinit(allocator);\n    const writer = buf.writer(allocator);\n\n    const issues = store.getAllRef();\n    var has_deps = false;\n\n    try writer.writeAll(\"Dependency Graph\\n\");\n    try writer.writeAll(\"================\\n\\n\");\n\n    for (issues) |issue| {\n        if (issue.dependencies.len > 0) {\n            has_deps = true;\n            const status_indicator = if (statusEql(issue.status, .closed)) \"[x]\" else \"[ ]\";\n            try writer.print(\"{s} {s} - {s}\\n\", .{ issue.id, status_indicator, truncateTitle(issue.title, 50) });\n\n            for (issue.dependencies, 0..) |dep, i| {\n                const is_last = (i == issue.dependencies.len - 1);\n                const connector = if (is_last) \"`-- depends on: \" else \"|-- depends on: \";\n\n                if (store.getRef(dep.depends_on_id)) |blocker| {\n                    const blocker_status = if (statusEql(blocker.status, .closed)) \"[x]\" else \"[ ]\";\n                    try writer.print(\"  {s}{s} {s} - {s}\\n\", .{ connector, blocker.id, blocker_status, truncateTitle(blocker.title, 40) });\n                } else {\n                    try writer.print(\"  {s}{s} [?] - (not found)\\n\", .{ connector, dep.depends_on_id });\n                }\n            }\n            try writer.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n        }\n    }\n\n    if (!has_deps) {\n        try writer.writeAll(\"No dependencies found.\\n\");\n    }\n\n    if (global.isStructuredOutput()) {\n        try output.printJson(GraphResult{\n            .success = true,\n            .format = \"ascii\",\n            .output = buf.items,\n        });\n    } else {\n        try output.raw(buf.items);\n    }\n}\n\nfn renderDotGraph(\n    graph: *DependencyGraph,\n    output: *Output,\n    root_id: []const u8,\n    max_depth: ?u32,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var buf: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(u8) = .{};\n    defer buf.deinit(allocator);\n    const writer = buf.writer(allocator);\n\n    var visited: std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(void) = .{};\n    defer {\n        var it = visited.keyIterator();\n        while (it.next()) |key| {\n            allocator.free(key.*);\n        }\n        visited.deinit(allocator);\n    }\n\n    var nodes: std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(void) = .{};\n    defer {\n        var it = nodes.keyIterator();\n        while (it.next()) |key| {\n            allocator.free(key.*);\n        }\n        nodes.deinit(allocator);\n    }\n\n    var edges: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(EdgeItem) = .{};\n    defer edges.deinit(allocator);\n\n    try collectGraphData(graph, root_id, 0, max_depth orelse 10, &visited, &nodes, &edges, allocator);\n\n    try writer.writeAll(\"digraph dependencies {\\n\");\n    try writer.writeAll(\"  rankdir=TB;\\n\");\n    try writer.writeAll(\"  node [shape=box, style=rounded];\\n\\n\");\n\n    var node_it = nodes.keyIterator();\n    while (node_it.next()) |key| {\n        if (graph.store.getRef(key.*)) |issue| {\n            const shape = if (statusEql(issue.status, .closed)) \"box, style=\\\"rounded,filled\\\", fillcolor=lightgray\" else \"box, style=rounded\";\n            try writer.print(\"  \\\"{s}\\\" [label=\\\"{s}\\\\n{s}\\\", {s}];\\n\", .{\n                key.*,\n                key.*,\n                escapeDotString(truncateTitle(issue.title, 30)),\n                shape,\n            });\n        }\n    }\n\n    try writer.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n\n    for (edges.items) |edge| {\n        try writer.print(\"  \\\"{s}\\\" -> \\\"{s}\\\";\\n\", .{ edge.from, edge.to });\n    }\n\n    try writer.writeAll(\"}\\n\");\n\n    if (global.isStructuredOutput()) {\n        try output.printJson(GraphResult{\n            .success = true,\n            .format = \"dot\",\n            .node_count = nodes.count(),\n            .edge_count = edges.items.len,\n            .output = buf.items,\n        });\n    } else {\n        try output.raw(buf.items);\n    }\n}\n\nfn renderDotFullGraph(\n    store: *storage.IssueStore,\n    output: *Output,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var buf: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(u8) = .{};\n    defer buf.deinit(allocator);\n    const writer = buf.writer(allocator);\n\n    const issues = store.getAllRef();\n\n    try writer.writeAll(\"digraph dependencies {\\n\");\n    try writer.writeAll(\"  rankdir=TB;\\n\");\n    try writer.writeAll(\"  node [shape=box, style=rounded];\\n\\n\");\n\n    var node_count: usize = 0;\n    var edge_count: usize = 0;\n\n    for (issues) |issue| {\n        if (issue.dependencies.len > 0 or hasAnyDependents(store, issue.id)) {\n            const shape = if (statusEql(issue.status, .closed)) \"box, style=\\\"rounded,filled\\\", fillcolor=lightgray\" else \"box, style=rounded\";\n            try writer.print(\"  \\\"{s}\\\" [label=\\\"{s}\\\\n{s}\\\", {s}];\\n\", .{\n                issue.id,\n                issue.id,\n                escapeDotString(truncateTitle(issue.title, 30)),\n                shape,\n            });\n            node_count += 1;\n        }\n    }\n\n    try writer.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n\n    for (issues) |issue| {\n        for (issue.dependencies) |dep| {\n            try writer.print(\"  \\\"{s}\\\" -> \\\"{s}\\\";\\n\", .{ issue.id, dep.depends_on_id });\n            edge_count += 1;\n        }\n    }\n\n    try writer.writeAll(\"}\\n\");\n\n    if (global.isStructuredOutput()) {\n        try output.printJson(GraphResult{\n            .success = true,\n            .format = \"dot\",\n            .node_count = node_count,\n            .edge_count = edge_count,\n            .output = buf.items,\n        });\n    } else {\n        try output.raw(buf.items);\n    }\n}\n\nfn collectGraphData(\n    graph: *DependencyGraph,\n    issue_id: []const u8,\n    depth: u32,\n    max_depth: u32,\n    visited: *std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(void),\n    nodes: *std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(void),\n    edges: *std.ArrayListUnmanaged(EdgeItem),\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    if (depth > max_depth) return;\n\n    const id_key = try allocator.dupe(u8, issue_id);\n    if (visited.contains(id_key)) {\n        allocator.free(id_key);\n        return;\n    }\n    try visited.put(allocator, id_key, {});\n\n    if (!nodes.contains(issue_id)) {\n        const node_key = try allocator.dupe(u8, issue_id);\n        try nodes.put(allocator, node_key, {});\n    }\n\n    const deps = try graph.getDependencies(issue_id);\n    defer graph.freeDependencies(deps);\n\n    for (deps) |dep| {\n        if (!nodes.contains(dep.depends_on_id)) {\n            const node_key = try allocator.dupe(u8, dep.depends_on_id);\n            try nodes.put(allocator, node_key, {});\n        }\n\n        try edges.append(allocator, .{ .from = issue_id, .to = dep.depends_on_id });\n\n        try collectGraphData(graph, dep.depends_on_id, depth + 1, max_depth, visited, nodes, edges, allocator);\n    }\n}\n\nfn hasAnyDependents(store: *storage.IssueStore, issue_id: []const u8) bool {\n    for (store.getAllRef()) |issue| {\n        for (issue.dependencies) |dep| {\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, dep.depends_on_id, issue_id)) {\n                return true;\n            }\n        }\n    }\n    return false;\n}\n\nfn truncateTitle(title: []const u8, max_len: usize) []const u8 {\n    if (title.len <= max_len) return title;\n    return title[0..max_len];\n}\n\nfn escapeDotString(s: []const u8) []const u8 {\n    return s;\n}\n\nfn statusEql(a: Status, b: Status) bool {\n    const Tag = std.meta.Tag(Status);\n    const tag_a: Tag = a;\n    const tag_b: Tag = b;\n    if (tag_a != tag_b) return false;\n    return if (tag_a == .custom) std.mem.eql(u8, a.custom, b.custom) else true;\n}\n\n// --- Tests ---\n\ntest \"GraphError enum exists\" {\n    const err: ?[]const u8 = null,\n};\n\npub fn run(\n    graph_args: args.GraphArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var ctx = (try CommandContext.init(allocator, global)) orelse {\n        return GraphError.WorkspaceNotInitialized;\n    };\n    defer ctx.deinit();\n\n    var dep_graph = ctx.createGraph();\n\n    if (graph_args.id) |id| {\n        if (!try ctx.store.exists(id)) {\n            try common.outputNotFoundError(GraphResult, &ctx.output, global.isStructuredOutput(), id, allocator);\n            return GraphError.IssueNotFound;\n        }\n        try renderIssueGraph(&dep_graph, &ctx.output, id, graph_args, global, allocator);\n    } else {\n        try renderFullGraph(&ctx.store, &ctx.output, graph_args, global, allocator);\n    }\n}\n\nfn renderIssueGraph(\n    graph: *DependencyGraph,\n    output: *Output,\n    issue_id: []const u8,\n    graph_args: args.GraphArgs,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    switch (graph_args.format) {\n        .ascii => try renderAsciiTree(graph, output, issue_id, graph_args.depth, global, allocator),\n        .dot => try renderDotGraph(graph, output, issue_id, graph_args.depth, global, allocator),\n    }\n}\n\nfn renderFullGraph(\n    store: *storage.IssueStore,\n    output: *Output,\n root_id: []const u8,\n    max_depth: ?u32,\n    global: args.GlobalOptions,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n) !void {\n    var buf: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(u8) = .{};\n    defer buf.deinit(allocator);\n    const writer = buf.writer(allocator);\n\n    var visited: std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(void) = .{};\n    defer {\n        var it = visited.keyIterator();\n        while (it.next()) |key| {\n            allocator.free(key.*);\n        }\n        visited.deinit(allocator);\n    }\n\n    const issue = graph.store.getRef(root_id) orelse return;\n    try prefix: []const u8,\n    _: bool, // is_last - unused, kept for API symmetry\n    depth: u32,\n    max_depth: u32,\n    visited: *std.StringHashMapUnmanaged(void),\n    allocator: return;\n    }\n    try visited.put(allocator, id_key, {});\n\n    const deps = try graph.getDependencies(issue_id);\n    defer graph.freeDependencies(deps);\n\n    for (deps, 0..) |dep, i| {\n        const is_last_dep = (i == deps.len - 1);\n        const connector = if (is_last_dep) \"`-- \" else \"|-- \";\n        const new_prefix_ext = if (is_last_dep) \"    \" else \"|   \";\n\n        const const status_indicator = if (statusEql(blocker.status, .closed)) \"[x]\" else \"[ ]\";\n            try writer.print(\"{s}{s}{s} {s} - {s}\\n\", .{\n                prefix,\n
